name: Fractured New York Quiz | Geography Fractures | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Albany.

	Albany is the capital of New York. It is located in upstate New York.My aunt once told me this joke about how Albany got it's name. The people who build cities had build this city and one worker said to the other, "So now all we have to do is name it." And the worker replied: "That's All Benny." (Albany).

Amsterdam.

	Amsterdam is located in Montgomery County. It is known for its large Puerto Rican population.

Beacon.

	Beacon is located in Dutchess County in New York.

Cortland.

	Cortland is in central New York in Cortland County. It is very much a college town having the State University of New York (SUNY) Cortland college there. Incidentally, SUNY Cortland is where I got my BA from.

Fulton.

	There are two cities named Fulton in New York. One is in Oswego County, while the other is in Schoharie County.

Buffalo.

	Buffalo is located in western New York. It is home of the Buffalo Bills football team.

Lackawanna.

	Lackawanna is located in Erie County in New York. It is located just south of Buffalo, New York.

New Rochelle.

	New Rochelle is located in Westchester County, New York. It is where the Petries lived on the old TV series "The Dick Van Dyke Show".

Oneida.

	Oneida is in Madison County, New York. It got its name from the Oneida tribe. The Oneida tribe's name means "People of the Upright Stone".

Poughkeepsie.

	Poughkeepsie is in Dutchess County, New York. The city is known as "The Queen of the Hudson".
